docs.lead_paragraph: The following Life Report was submitted in response to my column of Oct. 28, in which I asked readers over 70 to write autobiographical essays evaluating their own lives.

headline.main: Young Adults' Coverage May Cost Parents Even More

docs.abstract: Some employers are charging "per participant" now that adults up to age 26 can be carried on their families' plans.
docs.snippet: Some employers are charging "per participant" now that adults up to age 26 can be carried on their families' plans.

docs.lead_paragraph: A popular part of the federal health care legislation that allows young people to stay on their parents' insurance coverage until they are 26 is prompting some creative pricing by employers who are turning to new strategies to charge their workers extra for children on their benefit plans.

headline.main: Young Adults' Coverage May Cost Parents Even More

docs.abstract: Some employers are charging "per participant" now that adults up to age 26 can be carried on their families' plans.
docs.snippet: Some employers are charging "per participant" now that adults up to age 26 can be carried on their families' plans.

keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: The extra patent protection of the profitable drug Enbrel, a rheumatoid arthritis and psoriasis treatment, could keep a cheaper version off the market until 2028.

headline.seo: Amgen’s New Enbrel Patent May Undercut Health Care Plan
headline.main: Patent for Amgen Drug May Undercut Health Care Plan
headline.print_headline: Patent for Amgen Drug May Undercut Health Care Plan

docs.abstract: Amgen says new patent has been granted that could protect its big-selling drug Enbrel from generic competition until 2028, development that could undermine some of the savings contemplated in the federal health care legislation; Enbrel treats rheumatoid arthritis and psoriasis.
docs.snippet: The extra patent protection of the profitable drug Enbrel, a rheumatoid arthritis and psoriasis treatment, could keep a cheaper version off the market until 2028.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)

docs.lead_paragraph: Corrections appearing in print on November 23, 2011.
docs.snippet: Corrections appearing in print on November 23, 2011.

docs.lead_paragraph: In the whodunit of the financial crisis, the latest defense, surfacing in a fraud case filed by the Securities and Exchange Commission, is that federal regulators are to blame.
docs.abstract: Michael W Perry, former CEO of collapsed mortgage bank IndyMac, has alleged that top official at federal Office of Thrift Supervision advised him to backdate financial reports that are centerpiece of SEC suit against him; case raises questions about whether federal government has avoided pursuing fraud cases because of roles regulators may have played.
docs.snippet: In the whodunit of the financial crisis, the latest defense, surfacing in a fraud case filed by the Securities and Exchange Commission, is that federal regulators are to blame.

byline.original: By LOUISE STORY and GRETCHEN MORGENSON

docs.lead_paragraph: It would be a serious mistake for the Supreme Court to use the states’ rights argument in the reform case to restrict Congress’s spending power.

headline.seo: Health Care Reform and the States

docs.abstract: Editorial asserts that it would be a serious mistake for the Supreme Court to use the states’ rights argument in the health care reform law case as a way to restrict Congress’s spending power; asserts that curbing Congress's power to impose conditions on the disbursement of federal money would upend precedent and invite litigation and uncertainty that would harm all sectors of government.
docs.snippet: It would be a serious mistake for the Supreme Court to use the states’ rights argument in the reform case to restrict Congress’s spending power.

keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: An article on Saturday about a new Census Bureau count that put the number of people with incomes less than 50 percent above the poverty line -- a group known as the ''near poor'' -- far higher than previously thought described the health care for a quarter of that group incorrectly. They are uninsured; it is not the case that they have health insurance.

headline.main: What to Look for in Tonight's Debate

docs.abstract: As the presidential candidates gather once again for a debate tonight, voters and pundits will try to decide whether Newt Gingrich has transformed himself into a serious contender.
